def.dt: :an illness that affects a person, animal, or plant :a condition that prevents the body or mind from working normally count infectious/contagious diseases He suffers from a rare genetic disease. a deadly/debilitating disease a disease of the mind/kidneys diseases of poultry noncount Thousands die of heart disease each year. They are working to stop the spread of disease in rural areas. gum/liver disease

:a problem that a person, group, organization, or society has and cannot stop The article cites intolerance as one of the most dangerous of society's diseases. He sees crime as a disease that too often plagues the poor and disadvantaged.

utxt.vi: She removed the diseased tree limbs.

def.dt: :a disease of the brain that causes people to slowly lose their memory and mental abilities as they grow old called also Alzheimer's
:a disease of the brain that causes people to lose their memory, to no longer be able to control their muscles, and eventually to die called also CJD
:a disease that kills elm trees and that is caused by a fungus
:a serious and often deadly disease of animals (such as cows and sheep)
:a serious disease of the lungs that is caused by bacteria
:a serious disease that is spread by the bite of a small insect (called a deer tick)
:a fatal disease that affects the brain and nervous system of cattle
:a disease that affects the nervous system and causes people's muscles to become weak and their arms and legs to shake called also Parkinson's
